articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Louis Dreyfus owner pledges her stake as collateral in $1 billion Credit Suisse loan: filing
articles.description: Margarita Louis-Dreyfus borrowed $1 billion from Credit Suisse last year to buy out minority shareholders of Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC) and pledged her majority stake in the commodities trader as collateral, a company filing showed.
articles.content: PARIS (Reuters) - Margarita Louis-Dreyfus borrowed $1 billion from Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) last year to buy out minority shareholders of Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC) and pledged her majority stake in the commodities trader as collateral, a company filing showed… [+3002 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Britain alarmed by Iran nuclear announcement: PM spokesman
articles.description: Iran's announcement that it will abandon limitations on enriching uranium is extremely concerning and Britain is urgently speaking to parties about possible next steps, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Monday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Iran’s announcement that it will abandon limitations on enriching uranium is extremely concerning and Britain is urgently speaking to parties about possible next steps, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Monday.

articles.author: Elias Biryabarema
articles.title: Uganda police disperse supporters of Museveni challenger with tear gas
articles.description: Police in Uganda on Monday fired tear gas to disperse supporters of pop star and presidential hopeful Bobi Wine when he tried to hold a rally, underscoring the hurdles he faces as he seeks to unseat long ruling President Yoweri Museveni, 75.
articles.content: KAMPALA (Reuters) - Police in Uganda on Monday fired tear gas to disperse supporters of pop star and presidential hopeful Bobi Wine when he tried to hold a rally, underscoring the hurdles he faces as he seeks to unseat long ruling President Yoweri Museveni, 7… [+453 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK will not extend Brexit transition period: PM Johnson's spokesman
articles.description: Britain has no intention of seeking an extension to the transition period beyond December 2020 after it leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s spokesman said on Monday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain has no intention of seeking an extension to the transition period beyond December 2020 after it leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s spokesman said on Monday.

articles.title: EU's Borrell regrets Iran's step back from nuclear deal
articles.description: The European Union's foreign affairs chief Josep Borrell said on Monday he regretted Iran's latest announcement to step back from commitments to a 2015 nuclear deal with six major powers.
articles.content:
